comment.author: 12505015@N05
comment._content: Is it the Opera House localation?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [@aburinho - No, the Opera House location is the next headland to the left.] I think the photographer was on top of the 'Garden Palace' which was opened the previous year 1879, and burned down in 1882. Hence the great height and the flagpole on one of the towers. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Garden_Palace

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: Garden Island in the middle distance was soon to be transformed from crop gardens for the Navy, to a major fleet base.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: This fascinating 1895 T&CJ article on Garden Island (see pp. 28-29, 32-33) includes what looks like a crop of this pic...per the T&CJ the pic was taken in 1878, but I wouldn't necessarily assume the T&CJ was correct - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71231345 I'll also park the link to an 1893 Sydney Mail article on the Garden Island sheerlegs here, since they feature in the 1895 T&CJ article - news.google.com/newspapers?id=2jRVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=CJUDA...
